website_summaries.verdict: An impressive model that's often recommended by professional contractors for its solid build and water-removing capabilities – but the quality issues can be frustrating.
pros: An absolute powerhouse, thanks to its cast iron housing and 1/3-horsepower motor
Garners praise for removing large amounts of water quickly and efficiently
cons: Issues with the float switch malfunctioning have been reported

customer_reviews.title: Drill Your Own Weep Hole
customer_reviews.text: Best Sump Pump that you can buy. Nothing can stop it from working. One small problem is that the metal air hole in the pump will inevitably get clogged with gunk or rust so you need to drill a small 3/8th inch weep hole in the outlet pipe about 8" above the base of the pump and before the One Way Check Valve. This weep hole will allow any trapped air to escape and allow the pump to self-prime. If you get a large enough air bubble, the pump will run continuously and burn itself out while failing to pump out any water. Weep holes are needed for all sump pumps, no matter what brand.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond V.

customer_reviews.title: Dry socks are not overrated.
customer_reviews.text: I had one before that lasted 15 years with no problem. That one died on a Sunday afternoon, when the only open store was Home Depot. I had water coming in, so I had to replace it with a FloTec. That pump lasted two years, so I'm back to Old Faithful. Durable construction, powerful and pretty quiet. The reason for four stars is the requirement to drill a 3/16" hole in discharge pipe to prevent airlock. My pit is uncovered, and it's impossible to position that hole so that narrow shooting stream doesn't splash a little outside of the pit. A lot of manufacturers integrate that relief hole into the pump housing. Apart from that, I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Dmaniac278

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Packaging - Open Immediately
customer_reviews.text: Product received on time. Sump pump installation for our new home was not taking place for a bit. Open box yesterday to find that a metal piece that covers the power cord was broken off and another protective piece was crushed into pieces. The unit cannot be used in this condition. The pump is quite heavy for its size and the only packaging in the box was a small cardboard piece that sat on top. Whether it happened during warehousing or shipping, by the time we opened it, our return window was closed. Shame on me for not prioritizing the installation within the window of return, but the packaging was terrible and clearly attributed to the damage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: does not work all the time
customer_reviews.text: This will worked really good for about one month. Pumps a lot of water quickly. But has recently stopped working in the evenings. All I have to do is go down there and gently tap the sump pump or the discharge pipe in the sump pump will start working again. But this is cause 2 inches of water in the basement four different times. Very frustrating. I emailed the manufacturer and he stated there is a small air bubble in their. But that is all and he does not have any solutions on how to fix it
customer_reviews.author: bruce vance

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service was awful
customer_reviews.text: My pump started malfunctioning after 6 months. I called customer support, they were rude and told me I had to deal with Amazon, Amazon directed me to extended warranty company, but that did not kick in after a year due to the 1 year manufacturer warranty. I called Zoeller back, they were rude again, put me on hold for 10 minutes before an answering machine picked up. I left a VM but no one got back to me. Amazon finally made it right and replaced the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid pump!
customer_reviews.text: We had a flood in our basement on 3/19/20 and our pump was not keeping up with all the water coming in. Our neighbor brought over his extra pump which is this same pump that we bought off of Amazon (Zoeller). It went right to work and pumped out water at a faster rate then ours. 5 minutes after he hooked up his, ours quit! It is a bit noisy when it runs but it doesn’t stay on very long at all. We bought the same one that he let us use and we are happy. My husband installed it himself and said that it was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and quiet!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the top rated sump pumps online. I bought 2 after my basement flooded due to a pump failure. the M53 is cast iron with a plastic base. The M57 is all cast iron. This was east to install, it's powerful and quiet!
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: The M1 Abrams Of Sump Pumps
customer_reviews.text: This is a bona fide water war machine! Essentially, we have a river running underneath our house from March to June. To provide prospective and to quantify our typical WI Spring thaw experience: Our sump pump runs every 15 seconds for at least 8-10 weeks. I've had the same M53 installed for 3 years, cycling 15 seconds for 8-10 weeks! I've purchased backup replacements, not because they've failed, but because each have exceeded my performance expectation. I'm going on 9 years using the M53, not 1 problem. THANK YOU ZOELLER!!
customer_reviews.author: milwaukeephil

customer_reviews.title: Great little pump
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this pump to replace my first Mighty-mate that has run for 6 years with no problems. Sometime in wet weather it turns on and off every 30 seconds for hours and still no problems. I have a secondary pump but have not really needed it. Someday this little guy is bound to stop working so that is why I bought another one. I have lived in my house for 40 years and never had a pump this good.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Parker

customer_reviews.title: Uses over 700 watts for 0.3 hp motor?
customer_reviews.text: I used these for years in an industrial setting to transfer industrial gray water. Then one day I got a kill-a-watt plug in meter and tested these. 0.3 hp should be about 250 watts, maybe 500 volt-amps. These suckers pulled 750 - 850 watts, power factor of 1.0! Since they ran 20% - 90% of the time, it was worth the electrical bill to switch brands. We still use a few on occasion, and they are more reliable than the brands that replaced them, but it ended up being cheaper to put in two 1/3 hp pumps (that were pulling normal current) after the electrical bill was included. Be careful to not trip your breakers!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: No regrets - Wish I bought it sooner!
customer_reviews.text: As luck would have it my old pump died during a storm and I needed to find a replacement fast, so off to the big box store I went. All they had was cheap garbage and the pump was extremely loud especially the hammering noise when it shut off! I bought this pump to replace the cheap one and coupled it with a "quiet check valve" I found on amazon... I can't tell you how quiet it is! I wish I did it sooner, this pump is top quality and I can tell it will last for years. Buy one for yourself before you need it and never look back!
customer_reviews.author: E. Ivancic

customer_reviews.title: 1st Rate,Ready to go and quality and Superior service
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set in place with built in stainless steel handle and screws and waterproof electric cord and quiet operation,quick discharge of water in my sump.My other Zoeller lasted at least 8 years.It might have lasted longer if very hot furnace water sludge wasn't poured down into the sump soooo often.Because I believe over time that sludge and wine lees-sediment both contributed to my old pump's demise.From now on I will let clear water run as I am pouring anything down my sink for my pump to discharge. VeryVery satisfied with service and product.Company( A Plus) M.Z.F
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I just replaced my existing sump pump with this one. It was exactly the same model used by my basement guys originally installed. I almost never find that something is easier then expected however this was. As I said the last pump was the same make and model and lasted over 7 years. My basement guys said that the pump needed to be replaced but since we are in a pandemic I thought replacing this myself was a better idea.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Dependable - Best There Is
customer_reviews.text: I've got two sumps with 2 of these units in each sump. One main pump and a backup in each sump. The main pumps have each been replaced once in the 18 years they've been in service. The backups are still working, although since they are backups, they rarely see use. Pretty dependable service for these well-made pumps. I just replaced one that probably had a bad switch, but since the backup was operating, I didn't know the main pump was out of service and the main pump was submerged for quite a while and rusted out.
customer_reviews.author: Kaorisdad

customer_reviews.title: Zoeller is the best brand. Plumbers use it.
customer_reviews.text: Tested and working. IMPORTANT...read the directions and drill a 3/16” hole in the exit pipe approximately 4” above where it threads into the pump. This prevents air lock that will inevitably lead to the unit burning out... The lack of an exit/intake hole is common on most pumps. This easy precaution is necessary and it would be irresponsible to disregard it. The hole should be perpendicular to the pipe or better yet face down to the bottom of the basin at a 45 degree angle.
customer_reviews.author: Rtowns

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pump. Well made and should last for years
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pump. Well made and should last for years. Really powerful for the size. I'm basing this statement on how our 1 1/2" pipe system had to be installed in our crawl space to overcome obstacles in order to reach the outdoors. Have (1) 4 foot section going vertically upwards from the pump with a check valve on it; then a 10 foot section going horizontally North; then a 4 foot section going vertically upwards; then a 16 foot section going horizontally West; then a 3 foot section going vertically downwards; and finally a 10 foot section at ground level going horizontally North where the water exits. Amazing. Water comes out with a lot of force.
customer_reviews.author: J.HOT

customer_reviews.title: Pump switch made of inferior materials and does NOT last
customer_reviews.text: I had this pump for a few years. The switch on it nowadays is made of far inferior materials. It failed with no warning.
customer_reviews.author: I. Chudov

customer_reviews.title: ONLY SIX WEEKS old very disappointing!!!  Will not shut off half the time.
customer_reviews.text: Will not shut off half the time. Not sure when it will work or not .ONLY SIX WEEKS old very disappointing!!! I know this is a top rated company, guess I got lemon.
customer_reviews.author: David Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Great product, lousy shipping.
customer_reviews.text: When you need to buy a sump pump, it's usually a emergency, because the old pump failed. So we ordered it NEXT DAY Shipping. These idiots sent it ground from half the country away and we got it a week later. Thanks for nothing!
customer_reviews.author: S. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: I am glad that I ignored that feedback and ordered anyways because ...
customer_reviews.text: I hesitated to buy this product originally because someone mentioned that it was loud... I am glad that I ignored that feedback and ordered anyways because it is WAY quieter than the .5hp Wayne pump that I had down there. The amount of power that it has more than suits my needs and it empties the water in a few seconds. As others have mentioned, it is very well built. Easy to install. Amazon has a great price on this product. 5 out of 5 stars. Would give it more if I could,
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Not as good anymore
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Zoeller sump pump. It installs easily and works well, but. it. is. LOUDER. UPDATE: The pump operated erratically after a few months and buzzed. After only 2 years, it stopped working. Turns out it has a history of failing float switch. I'm taking my chance with a different brand for replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Yowza

customer_reviews.title: What Warranty...........................
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sump about a year and a half ago, and it just failed. It apparently froze up and was blowing the fault. It states that it has a 3 year warranty, but when I talk to Amazon....it's 30 days. I think I just had a lemon, but AMAZON is the real LEMON.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Had a standing water problem in my back yard after ...
customer_reviews.text: Had a standing water problem in my back yard after rainstorms that just could be solved by gravity driven drainage. Installed some french drains leading to a buried 30 gal sump and utilized this Zoeller Mighty-mate to empty it out. The output is pumped to the front street-side drainage culvert via a buried 1 1/2 " PVC pipe. In testing, it worked fantastically. Can't wait for the next big rainstorm ( not a Hurricane Harvey sized one ) to see it in action!
customer_reviews.author: Ken K

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by Apple Drains
customer_reviews.text: Before we installed our sump pump I researched extensively. Apple drains has many informative videos on youtube on sump pump installs. He recommends zoeller pumps. It is running wonderfully. It's a heavy duty, quiet, and powerful pump. It is quite a sense of relief knowing that our basement is going to be dry this winter and next spring!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: I have used this brand of sump and they work great but every 5 years I got to get a ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a basement that fills with water every winter live in Oregon and water gets in my basement. I have used this brand of sump and they work great but every 5 years I got to get a new one. Well 5 the year is here. And I got to get a new one. My really old one is doing the job for now but the other one shit the bed. So going to have to order one.
customer_reviews.author: starry night

customer_reviews.title: Replaced with another M53 after 12 years of service
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the quality and overall operation of this pump! I just replaced my old M53 after 12 years of service with another M53. This pump provided worry free operation throughout its life. I have had the replacement on my shelf for the last 4 years. Replacement was simple plug and play. Plan to buy another M53 for backup and hopefully I will get another 12 years of service from the replacement pump.
customer_reviews.author: howco

customer_reviews.title: Far better than other pumps
customer_reviews.text: The metal housing and the quality of the pump parts makes this a far better option than others. Most important, the pump float is tighter to the motor than in other models, so it doesn't get stuck in the sump. Other models seem to not fire up sometimes when the pump float gets tangled or stuck, which results in a mess. Accept no other substitutes for this.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Davis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my setup
customer_reviews.text: The sump that came with the home I bought had an aging, but well functioning sump pump - and a shallow basin. I installed a 20 gallon basin, along with this pump, and the quiet check valve. Everything works perfectly. The pump is very powerful. I recommend using something to insulate it from the basin, and make sure to insulate the outflow pipe as well because it will make noise if you don't. The long cord makes this a great piece of kit.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Hodgkins

customer_reviews.title: Good sump pump
customer_reviews.text: Replace a similar pump that had lasted 12-15 years with this one and it is a very efficient and quiet pump. I highly recommend using a quiet check valve like the Zoeller
customer_reviews.author: Jeff2468

customer_reviews.title: Rugged and reliable sump pump, with fine reputation.
customer_reviews.text: After owning our house in Iowa for 25+ years, with routine sump pump needs during spring and summer, I figured I should pro-actively replace whatever brand pump was in the sump, that had never given any trouble. (!) I also questioned whether anything that old and reliable would still be available. Well it was a Zoeller, so I was happy to find that the "Made in USA" product is still being made. The new one has continued the 100% reliability tradition so far, during the needs of 2018.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Beast of a pump
customer_reviews.text: I just added a sump to pick up my backyard drainage (it's really picking up my neighborhood). So glad I put this in because three weeks ago we got a record downpour (3.6" in one hour). I estimate water was coming into our backyard at over 1,000gpm from all of the neighbors. While this pump couldn't keep up with that flow, it ran for about 4 hours nonstop until the backyard was dry. I have another one of these pumps in my basement and it's been working without issue for about 7 years. I would definitely recommend this pump.
customer_reviews.author: pardenk

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, quiet pump.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an identical pump that was 20 years old. And it just had an intermittent switch but i felt it was easier to just replace the whole pump. It's also shorter that most others. I have a backup sump pump that sits atop this one so height for me was important.
customer_reviews.author: DBD

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I replace my sump pump every 5 or 6 years. I have a finished basement and the cost of a new pump is a small price to pay for peace of mind. I have had this model Zoeller pump for the last 11 years, this is my 3rd pump. I have never had a Zoeller pump fail on me. (Hope I didn't just jinx myself.) I have had other manufacturer pumps fail, but never Zoeller. Zoeller makes very good products, worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Bob S.

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than 3 years
customer_reviews.text: Not recommended. Failed after less than 3 years with no "real" warranty. Was told you have to pay for labor if you're not near a "customer service center" I see a new switch assembly is available for $70. I got a whole new pump for that. A good company would've have offered the switch assembly for free to fix a known issue with these pumps.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: A Quality Pump
customer_reviews.text: When my old sump pump failed, I checked what the online community had to say about sump pumps. Zoeller was mentioned repeatedly as a quality brand. Unfortunately, my local Lowes store did not stock Zoeller, so I purchased through Amazon. It was no more expensive than similar pumps carried at Lowes. I have been very pleased with the pump. It is quiet and efficient. Further, it is designed so that the switch (the part most likely to fail) is replaceable. I like that the engineers were thinking of the DIY consumer user when they designed the product.
customer_reviews.author: unit2735

customer_reviews.title: Worked very well while it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this pump in June of 2016. It ran very well but has recently stopped working now in March of 2019. I'm a little disappointed considering this company is highly regarded for producing workhorse water movers. It's the spring thaw here in the North East USA and currently I have 10" of standing water in the basement, so it must have given out a while ago. I've reached out to customer service regarding the warranty and will update again.
customer_reviews.author: KJamesJR

customer_reviews.title: Simple replacement of my Zoeller that was still working after 10 years
customer_reviews.text: I swapped out a 10 year old Zoeller pump like this one out of an abundance of caution - it was still working fine, but I didn't want to tempt fate. That's the best review possible - 10 years of service for anything these days is pretty good. The old one saw regular use - the sump fills quickly when the ground is wet. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: fjp_tt

customer_reviews.title: Exact Replacement for Old Sump - Quiet and Dependable
customer_reviews.text: These things are awesome, quiet and dependable is the best way to describe them. It fit perfectly the sump it was replacing, which leaked a little water into the switch. I'd buy these every time, worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Pignutr

customer_reviews.title: Zoeller. The only pump I’ll buy
customer_reviews.text: Quality pumps for the 20 years or so I’ve owned them. I have a sewage pump for a basement bathroom and two sump pumps.. All Zoeller of course. I am comfortable with their quality, construction and reliability.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Mazon

customer_reviews.title: Zoeller makes the best pumps
customer_reviews.text: I only buy the Zoeller pumps for my home as I know they are a brand you can trust. the warranty isnt as good as some competitors but the quality of these pumps precedes the companies reputation. they are workhorses. I finally just replaced my original Zoeller pump after 18 years. and it still worked, I just didn't want to chance it ever breaking as we get a lot of water in our sump pit.
customer_reviews.author: DANBOY

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Much quieter than my old one. Intake is on bottom and never clogs. Really small stuff less than 1/4" would clog old unit. This one pumped out leaves, sand and small tree droppings and flow rate never changed. Better built and has replacement parts- Yes! Very happy as now I do not have to clean out small debris out of sump pump box every month. I have a screen on pump box to keep out large stuff so now with this pump I may not have to clean out anything. Yippee!!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard S.

customer_reviews.title: The one to have
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, quiet low vibration, but the float switch is set to throw out a few gallons and it will cycle on in just a minute. It would be better set to go on for empty the pit and stay off for five in a heavy rain. It does not look like it is adjustable. Still that said, it is top of the line.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy De Lisle

customer_reviews.title: A nice simple unit but if you have the room try ...
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my old pump of the same model recently. First one lasted 4 years with heavy use. When it broke the float lever arm gave out and the pump was unable to turn itself off, but the pump still worked. A nice simple unit but if you have the room try the .5hp... Don't let your contractor or plumber upcharge you an arm and a leg when you can get this and install yourself or pay them to do it..
customer_reviews.author: KBT42

customer_reviews.title: WILL NOT LAST!  Water in basement in less than 2 years!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very upset after having this for 16 months that tonight my basement flooded because it failed to operate. It is touted as a solid brand but I'm very upset what this REALLY ended up costing me in the end. I'd say go to Home Depot and ask for better advice on what to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well Made Sump Pump
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this sump pump for years. The life I get is around 5 years which is not bad. The float set up is made well but is the first thing to fail. Also the float set up results in short run cycles and short off cycles, so it pumps frequently. When mine is busy it will turn on every 8 seconds.A float that would take longer (float would have to rise higher before starting the pump)would result in longer run times and thus would be more efficient then quick on and off cycles.
customer_reviews.author: wgacker

customer_reviews.title: Love this brand
customer_reviews.text: I am replacing this same exact pump that I have had for 12 yrs. Prices were pretty consistent everywhere. I could get it here the quickest. I actually got it a day early. Win/win
customer_reviews.author: L. Baize

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse!  This thing gets the job done!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Know the term "built like a brick s house"? Well that may have been coined after this pump! Lol. It weighs a ton and is solid all around. It's also relatively quiet when it runs. It carried us through various big storms, including hurricane sandy (thankfully we had a battery back up and generator). Anyway, this thing is reliable, quiet and provides a comfort level during those daunting storms. Buy without hesitation and put your mind at ease. One point, make sure you buy the accompanying check valve, a part that many people skip which will result in premature death of a pump from cycling over and over again with water that stays in the pipe.
customer_reviews.author: lthj75

customer_reviews.title: Dunno about "longevity"....
customer_reviews.text: ....time will tell how long it will last. But I can tell you that this is VERY quite and is easy to install. Feels and looks solid, hope it lasts a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Hodge III

customer_reviews.title: and a longer vertical float distance would be nice, but I trust this little beast to handle ...
customer_reviews.text: For 25+ years we've pumped out tons of water throughout our usual six months of Pacific rainstorms. We've worn out several pumps. This one has been rock solid, and I think it'll be a long term pump. The on/off cycle is too short, I think, and a longer vertical float distance would be nice, but I trust this little beast to handle the worst possible deluges.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Osborne

customer_reviews.title: don't wait to see if it works
customer_reviews.text: this item did not work out of the box, unfortunately it was 65 days after order was placed that I was ready for installation so now trying to get a replacement from Amazon is proving most difficult.
customer_reviews.author: 1SG Milo, US Army, (Ret.)

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: this is replacing the same model that is over 15 years old (still working) in one of my sump wells. the original worked very well. Expect this one to be as good.
customer_reviews.author: brassrod

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy build and appears to be reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Installed in an outside drain box we installed for a client who was having a small pond develop in her lawn areas. Working fine through several hard rains and over wintering just fine so far.
customer_reviews.author: T. G. Kraft

customer_reviews.title: Great pump, very solid.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pump to help with flooding in my backyard during the monsoons in Arizona and it has fit the bill very nicely. It is a heavy (very) pump, but that is a good thing. Some of the cheaper pumps I bought at big box stores would fall over and in once instance continue to run with no water, and burned out. The Zoeller will not fall over, it's the best quality pump i've had, solid as a rock, pumps a lot of water, and has a nice guard around the top of the float to keep anything from interfering.
customer_reviews.author: Fatspatula

customer_reviews.title: Same problem- Switch fails....
customer_reviews.text: Same problem with me. This is my fourth Zoeller M53 and I just always replace them religiously at five years. My last one just went out at four years with the same problem: the pump won't shut off because of the switch. While four years ain't bad, its less than the past. I'll be researching alternatives and purchase a different brand. My coworker recommends a switchless model: Stevens SS57A Submersible Sump Pump.
customer_reviews.author: DBurk

customer_reviews.title: Again broken after 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: Again broken after 2 years because the off switch malfunctioned. This leaves the pump running non stop. Had the exact same issue with the previous one I bought. This is getting too expensive.
customer_reviews.author: douwe

customer_reviews.title: Buy the best
customer_reviews.text: Buy the best. It is worth it. The sump pump in my house failed. I bought a Rigid from Home Depot. What a mistake. The pump overheated and failed leaving me with 6" of water in the basement. I replaced it with a Zoeller and not have not had a problem since.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Lasted one year and died
customer_reviews.text: I purchased through Amazon new and it lasted one year and died and now I need to find out who will cover the 3 year warranty on it. I anticipate a run around..
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality Pump
customer_reviews.text: I have used these pumps for years. I replace mine once every 2 years because I live in a flood plain and it runs continuously. Iron rich well water can take a toll on any mechanical device. The switch does stay on when the machine is rotted but this takes 2+ years in constant submersion and running in my experience. When it does it will run hot but it is in a sump pit so the likelihood of a fire is minimal at best. You will hear it also so you know something is wrong and time to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Two jobs
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this brand for over three years to pump the water from the backyard to (100 ft.) the front of the house where it can drain into the street and another pump used to take water from the clothes washer in the garage to a drain pipe (30 ft.) under the house. They both sit in water all year and continue to do their job. I love em!
customer_reviews.author: George Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Just installed my 3rd one of these
customer_reviews.text: My sump pump runs every 2 minutes or so after a storm, and just frequently all the time. These pumps have never failed me, I just take them out every 3-4 years and replace them to be safe. A wise old plumber told me about these pumps about 10 years ago. He said they are the best, most reliable ones, and I can verify that!
customer_reviews.author: S. Pozun

customer_reviews.title: Longevity is great!
customer_reviews.text: This review is not about the sump pump I purchased, but about the one I'm replacing--which happens to be the exact same brand and model of the one I purchased! The Zoeller M53 pump that I replaced was original to the house we had built in 2003. Thus the old pump worked reliably for over ten years. But it started feeling its age a couple of times in recent months in terms of the switch not shutting off; I had to reach down into the sump-pump well and jiggle the switch to turn off the pump manually. So I figured it was time for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald L. Nickelson

customer_reviews.title: I have about 10' of head it has to overcome and it easily pumps water out
customer_reviews.text: 1-1/2" outlet and very powerful. I have about 10' of head it has to overcome and it easily pumps water out. I have a check valve just past the pump. I had to find a make shift stand to put the pump on, would be nice if they included a rubber or plastic stand. Plugs into a standard 15A outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a good pump!
customer_reviews.text: We used this pump for our septic system. We did find out that the pump will clog when someone flushes underwear down the toilet! ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Littlefield

customer_reviews.title: Great sump pump. Built like a tank!
customer_reviews.text: I forgot to review this when i first bought it. It's now been years and it still works like new. It was very easy to install and it's built like a tank.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: DROPIN AND WORKING IN 5 MINUTES
customer_reviews.text: GREAT REPLACEMENT FOR THE "BASEMENT SYSTEMS PUMP THAT CAME WITH OUR INSTALLATION. 5 MINUTES AND IT WAS UP AND RUNNING.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: the pump was still working well so I felt good doing an exact replacement
customer_reviews.text: This is an exact replacement for the one that had the switch fail open (wouldn't turn off). After 12 years of operation, the pump was still working well so I felt good doing an exact replacement. Shipping was fast, install was easy. And the basement is dry!
customer_reviews.author: gallkat

customer_reviews.title: Great pump
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased my 2nd Zoeller M53 pump. I have never had a problem with my first pump. I am only replacing it for peace of mind as first pump is nearly eight years old.
customer_reviews.author: Dick

customer_reviews.title: Great pump, seems built to last
customer_reviews.text: The white plugs in top are supposed to be there. They are apparently used as test ports at the factory. Also when you drill the vent hole if using a check valve keep in mind the steam comes out very strong. I used a 3/16" hole. Great pump, seems built to last. 1 1/2" output port as well.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: It's quality to last 20+ years
customer_reviews.text: I have no leaks in my crawlspace but ground water works its way to humidity my crawl. So I did some back breaking work dug and installed drainage lines leading to a sump pit.. now it just works its way to the pit and gets pumped out.
customer_reviews.author: No Name

customer_reviews.title: Never buy a house that needs a sump pump!  (Too late huh?)
customer_reviews.text: I have had this pump for 5 years now with no problems. I would recommend a spring operated check valve so you don’t have to hear that “clunk” sound. Cheap and much easier to sleep at night. Update.. 1/18/2020. Switch failed spring of 2019. Replaced pump with a superior brand pump with external switch. Plan on replacing switch on zoeller pump and using it as a spare. Internal switches are a bad idea.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The main thing is that it was made in the USA.
customer_reviews.text: That was most important. Plus 36 months of warranty, not bad!
customer_reviews.author: Dmitriy G.

customer_reviews.title: Installation Challenges
customer_reviews.text: Just bought and installed the M53 pump to replace the old ABS pump (25 year old). To my supersize the cable is approx 8 feet long and about 2 feet shorter than the old pump and I end up relocating the electric outlet, which had to hang from the ceiling about 2 feet and looks very strange. That was the only option or returning the pump. The electrical code does not allow using extension cord on the pump. All the other pumps that I look at had 10 feet cable. For a product that seems to be one of the best does not make sense why the company went cheap with the cable?
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great Pump
customer_reviews.text: It's a workhorse at a good price. Never have problems with Zoeller. Last one lasted 7 years. I keep a back up on the shelf, for when it finally gives out.
customer_reviews.author: TrainTec

customer_reviews.title: No more flooding!
customer_reviews.text: My husband made a weekend project out of this awesome little machine. We were having problems at our back door with water overflowing into our house whenever we would get a heavy rain. Now that concern is a thing of the past.
customer_reviews.author: Allanafl

customer_reviews.title: The gold standard of sump pumps
customer_reviews.text: The best sump pump for your home. Last song, quiet, effective, easy to install. Stay away form the other cheaper pumps. When you need pump it has to deliver. Zoeller pumps deliver.
customer_reviews.author: Vettran

customer_reviews.title: Long life
customer_reviews.text: I really like the cast iron construction. Plastic just feels to flimsy, and most of the stainless steel pumps are mostly plastic anyway. The last one I had of this model worked well for 12 years, but the switch has become unreliable. Due to its age, I'm replacing the entire thing with a new one, and I'm getting the same model because I've never had a sump pump work so reliably and for so long. The one drawback is the float switch. You might have to clean around the switch lever every so often so it works freely.
customer_reviews.author: Direwolf

customer_reviews.title: The real deal
customer_reviews.text: It's true these pumps are beasts. Not sure exactly how long it'll last which is why I got this as a back up to the contractor installed one. I've been using it a few years that's worked continuously at times and has not failed. Most knowledgeable plumbers/waterproofers etc. seem to use and recommend zoeller
customer_reviews.author: A. Guy

customer_reviews.title: It was in good condition. I was able to replace my 20 ...
customer_reviews.text: it came when I expected it. It was in good condition. I was able to replace my 20 year old model with it. We haven't had a heavy rain yet (mine is for heavy rain, not day to day use) so I can't say anything about it's operation. I expect it will be great and last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: NoGiftsPlease

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pump
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pump to replace the 20 year old sump pump that was in the house when we moved it, and which recently stopped working,,,thankfully during a test and not an actual flooding situation. After doing extensive research online, I found that this pump was used by more plumbers and basement installation professionals than any other. So I bought it. It was painfully easy to install. Including cutting new pvc pipe to match the new pump requirements (the old pump was a pedestal-style) it took about 20 minutes to install.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Mcnelis

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered via Prime, and pump arrived in 2 days in excellent shape. California is under drought conditions so it is important to save water. My grandkids, and Golden Retrievers love to swim in our pool, but they waste gallons of water each time they get out. So I hooked up a basin & Zoeller sump, and send the water to a holding tank to be filtered, & then back to the pool. Pump was easy to set up, works great, and runs very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very quit
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace the one in my basement with this one. I could hardly tell it even turned on.
customer_reviews.author: lwolf

customer_reviews.title: Works well since july 2012. It failed on April 13th 2020
customer_reviews.text: Liked that it was easy to install, very quiet, pumps well. Bottom line is that it failed and my basement flooded. I will replace it with the same model and hope that Zoeller has gotten more reliable. I like to by US made products and the choices are getting more difficult. The pump is more expensive than the competition but I'm not sure it's worth it considering the reliability
customer_reviews.author: Andre Y Weiser

customer_reviews.title: The BEST sumppump
customer_reviews.text: Zoeller is the BEST sump pump on the market . My last M53 lasted over 10 years. I actually rebuild one one to keep on shelf in basement for a backup pump.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Pump
customer_reviews.text: My last pump worked for over 13 yrs. We have rivers under our property so we have got plenty of use from our Zoeller pump. I think if I had replacement rubber boots to keep the water out of the switch it would still be in use. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Ed B.

customer_reviews.title: Good, durable unit.
customer_reviews.text: Good strength. Be mindful if calcium deposits that can adversely affect the float motion and therefore pump operation.
customer_reviews.author: SMK

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a twenty-five year old pump of the same model, hope this one lasts as long. Seems to have a shorter pump on time before the float drops and shuts it off again, but is quietly working away down there....
customer_reviews.author: Steven R

customer_reviews.title: BathtubsPlus.com
customer_reviews.text: Purchased from BathtubsPlus.com. Wanted the Zoeller because of their reputation. Pump stopped working after 18 months. BathtubsPlus will not honor the warranty because the pump was manufactured before the warranty period. BathtubsPlus sold me an older pump but will still not honor the warranty. No more Zoeller pumps for me and no more purchasing anything from BathtubsPlus.com!!!
customer_reviews.author: P. barbato

customer_reviews.title: Durable and reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Been in for several months and works fantastic. Make sure you read the installation instructions. However they are clear and easy to understand.
customer_reviews.author: JJ Smiley

customer_reviews.title: Recommended to me by almost every plumber I've spoken to
customer_reviews.text: If you live in a wet area, and your sump runs frequently, this is the one. Recommended to me by almost every plumber I've spoken to, and the one my buddy that does basement work has in his own house. I cheaped out last year and put in a home depot pump to replace a Zoeller with the switch going bad, and came home one day to a wading pool in my basement. wont make that mistake again.
customer_reviews.author: Roadrash

customer_reviews.title: Switch Intermitantly Failing in first 3 Mounths; TOTAL PIA !!! - STAY AWAY !
customer_reviews.text: Pump seems well built, but it is only as good as the switch. Looks like switch is not easy to replace as it is inside a sealed housing. Pump has only been in service for 3 months. I would NOT buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Without peer
customer_reviews.text: If you have a high water table and need a pump to be ready to run regularly, there is nothing that compares to this beast. The Home Depot/Lowe’s OTS sumps are good, but this is a cast iron monster. We’re on our second one. First one lasted 15 years. Sometimes it runs every 60 seconds for months.
customer_reviews.author: T. Morton

customer_reviews.title: Great long lasting pump
customer_reviews.text: Great pump! It’s just as quiet as the old pump was! If you need a great sump pump for the price and sturdy this is your pump! My old pump was the same as this brand and size, it lasted 15 years can’t beat it!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Good history with this model.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the exact same model that ran for over 15 years. It was in a crawl space sump and was busy most of the year. The old one shorted out, could have been as simple as a needing a new switch but the swap-out was the easiest approach.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Big assistance in basement
customer_reviews.text: Cannot speak about longevity since this sump pump was just installed. It seems to be working fine and removing the water as it accumulates in the pit
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: Zoeller will not warranty this when not purchased from a supply house. The packaging was so poor that I don't blame them one bit. It had a single piece of paper stuffed into an oversize box with the pump box rumbling around in there... yeah good luck with that.
customer_reviews.author: Crisp

customer_reviews.title: Sucks like my life.
customer_reviews.text: This thing sucks and pumps like a lady of the night. Buy it, and clear out your moisture issues ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Past Master 2014

customer_reviews.title: The best pump around
customer_reviews.text: This pump is the baseline for all others. Strong, reliable and fairly quiet. Only weakness is the on off switch. Which is why I gave it 3 stars for longevity.
customer_reviews.author: jpf

customer_reviews.title: best sump pump on the market
customer_reviews.text: best sump pump on the market, i have had sump pumps for 30 years, hate them, but these guys last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Аmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: keeping us dry.
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to install and is so quiet. reliable and though the weather has been very wet, this has helped us stay dry!
customer_reviews.author: R. Pierini

customer_reviews.title: New install
customer_reviews.text: The unit is working as expected, been active for 4 weeks. I will review again at the 6 month mark, and update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Steve's Account

product_meta.title: Zoeller M53 Mighty-mate Submersible Sump Pump, 1/3 Hp
product_meta.description:
Size:1Foeller Pump Co. M-53 Mighty Mate clear effluent or dewatering submersible pump. Choice of many plumbers and contractors. 1/3 HP cast iron housing with plastic vortex impeller. 9ft. power cord. Truly a all star pump. Powder coated epoxy CI and SS fasteners. Oil filled motor with thermal overload. CSA UL SSPMA

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
When you have residential or commercial wastewater issues, you can count on Zoeller Pumps to deliver the very best solutions-our commitment to top quality offers you years of service and durability.
feature_bullets: 3/10 HP pump for residential sump pits or septic tanks
Automatic model with integral float-activated switch
Cast iron switch case, motor, and pump housing, plastic base
Performance: 43 GPM at 5' TDH, shut-off: 19.25' TDH. 100% factory tested

specifications.Material: Engineered Thermoplastic Base, Cast Iron Switch
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,358 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
